title: The Pepper Seller Bride (Gilaki)

source_text.text:
﻿A pepper seller is promised against her will to a harsh lord (in some tellings, a div). An old woman pities the bride-to-be and slips her three objects: a pouch of pepper, a comb, and a mirror, telling her to use them only if she must escape.

On the wedding night, the bride and a loyal servant lead the pepper seller’s donkey away quietly, carrying the three objects.

The lord/div wakes and gallops after them. The bride throws the pepper; a stinging sandstorm blinds him. She throws the comb; it sprouts into a thorn forest he must hack through. She throws the mirror; it shatters into a river of glassy shards that cut his feet, forcing him to stop.

Reaching a caravanserai, she reunites with her pepper-seller sweetheart. The community sides with the lovers, and they marry freely, having outwitted coercion.

paragraph_summaries: A pepper seller is promised as bride to a brutal lord (or div). An old woman pities her and gifts a pouch of pepper, a comb, and a mirror to use if she must flee.
On the wedding night the bride slips out with a servant ally, taking the three objects and the pepper seller’s donkey.
The lord/div wakes and chases. She throws the pepper, raising a blinding sandstorm; the comb, sprouting a thorn forest; the mirror, which shatters into a river of glassy shards that halts pursuit.
Safe at a caravanserai, she reunites with her pepper-seller sweetheart and marries him openly with community blessing.

Pepper, comb, and mirror are given as magical agents.
Thrown objects transform into obstacles that stop the pursuer.

bias_reflection.cultural_reading: Shows communal aid to an unwilling bride; flight framed as reclaiming choice.
bias_reflection.gender_norms: Female protagonist drives plan; helper is another woman, highlighting female solidarity.
bias_reflection.hero_villain_mapping: Pursuer as coercive male power; heroine and helper as agents of resistance.

source_text_persian.text: عروس فروشنده‌ی فلفل را به زور به خان می‌دهند. پیرزنی به او فلفل، شانه و آینه می‌دهد برای فرار. خان می‌رسد و دختر هر سه را می‌اندازد: فلفل طوفان شن، شانه جنگل خار و آینه رود تیزپهن می‌شود. او به کاروانسرا می‌رسد و با دلدارش آزادانه ازدواج می‌کند.
